alert.note: Alert for Northern Fairfield; Northern New Haven; Southern Fairfield; Southern New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:51AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Fairfield, western New Haven, northern Westchester, Putnam, west central Suffolk and northeastern Nassau Counties through 930 AM EDT... At 851 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lake Carmel to Commack. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bridgeport, Stamford, Norwalk, Danbury, Milford, Shelton, Commack, Huntington Station, Naugatuck, Centereach, Southbury, New Canaan, Syosset, Huntington and Stony Brook. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northern Fairfield; Northern New Haven; Southern Fairfield; Southern New Haven
